intro: Robertsonia pensylvanica, commonly known as the Pennsylvania false button. It is a member of the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Robertsonia pensylvanica is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
